icontrol.drivers

Interface GPIB_Prologix.ftd2xx

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.sun.jna.Library
    Enclosing class:
    GPIB_Prologix

    private static interface GPIB_Prologix.ftd2xx
extends com.sun.jna.Library
    Defines the interface required by JNA to invoke the native library.

    This interface defines all function calls 'into' the native code (.dll / .dylib). It is the standard, stable way of mapping, which supports extensive customization and mapping of Java to native types.

    Please note that not all function declaration have been imported from ftd2xx.h while most constants should have been included.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.sun.jna.Library

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Close the connection to the FTDI device (that is the Prologix GPIB-USB controller

      Gets the device status including number of characters in the receive queue, number of characters in the transmit queue, and the current event status.

      Open the specified FTDI device and return a handle that will be used for subsequent accesses.

      • FT_CreateDeviceInfoList

        int FT_CreateDeviceInfoList(com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference NumberOfDevices)
        This function builds a FTDI device information list and returns the number of D2XX devices connected to the system. The list contains information about both unopened and opened devices. See page 7

      • FT_GetDeviceInfoDetail

        int FT_GetDeviceInfoDetail(int Index,
                           com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference Flags,
                           com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference Type,

                           com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference LocationID,
                           byte[] SerialNr,
                           byte[] Description,
                           com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference ftHandle)
        This function returns an entry from the FTDI device information list. Ensure that FT_CreateDeviceInfoList has been called before invoking this method.

      • FT_OpenEx

        int FT_OpenEx(java.lang.String Arg1,
              int Flags,
              com.sun.jna.ptr.IntByReference ftHandle)
        Open the specified FTDI device and return a handle that will be used for subsequent accesses. Note that with Arg1 defined as String, FT_OPEN_BY_LOCATION can not be used.

      • FT_SetTimeouts

        int FT_SetTimeouts(int ftHandle,
                   int ReadTimeOut,
                   int WriteTimeOut)
        Set the read and write timeouts for communication with the FTDI chip over the USB bus. This is not the TimeOut for GPIB communication.
